revised_title: The Bridgewater Treatises and the Selection of Their Authors
tldr: This article discusses the selection of authors for the Bridgewater Treatises, a series of eight books on natural theology published between 1833 and 1836. The author, W. H. Brock, examines the background and context of the treatises, including the beliefs of their authors and the influence of the design argument in 18th and 19th-century science. The article also highlights the role of the Royal Society in the publication process and the challenges faced by the society's president, Davies Gilbert, in selecting qualified authors for the project.
